text: How do algebraic expression and equation help express patterns and relationships between factors and multiples?

Students might discuss that algebraic expressions

  • have variables, which are letters standing for numbers;
  • are ways to write what we say with words; and
  • give us some shortcuts to say something (much like emojis or texting acronyms, such as lol).

Students might give examples, such as 3N is a multiple of 3, it has two factors 3 and N, and N itself may have other factors.

Students might discuss that algebraic equations

  • are made up of expressions (so all relationships above apply); and
  • show quantities that are equal or show expressions that are equal.
